title: [FEATURE] Create a component for cards
body:
**Description**

We should create a reusable card component that can be used for various items like books, tools, etc., You can then use this Card component to create specific components like BookCard, ToolCard, etc.
author: devvsakib

comments.body: I will work on it

this is a good idea.

anyway, we don't want to be tied 100% toa  single component, because the logic and the field inside each card might differ *for people we might need different fields compared to book, for example

but we should feinitively work on something consistent

I am honestly kinda happy for how it looks so far, just a few inconsistencies, but we are using very simple layouts

title: [DOCS] Update Contributing file
body:
**Description**

Update the `CONTRIBUTING.md` file to include detailed guidelines for new contributors. The current contributing file lacks proper guidelines, leading to contributors making PRs without assigning issues to themselves and other procedural oversights.

**Expected Behavior**

What should happen?

**Actual Behavior**

What happens instead?

**Screenshots (if applicable)**

Add screenshots or other media to help explain the issue.

**Additional Information**

Add any other context or information about the issue here.
author: devvsakib

comments.body: @FrancescoXX I will working on it, assign this issue to me
Thank you @devvsakib

title: [FEATURE] Add Shadcn UI Support
body:
**Description**

We aim to integrate Shadcn UI into our project to enhance the UI components with a modern and consistent design. This will involve setting up Shadcn UI and refactoring existing components to use Shadcn UI where applicable.

**Expected Behavior**

- Shadcn UI should be installed and configured correctly within the project.
- Existing UI components should be refactored to use Shadcn UI components where appropriate.
- The overall design should be consistent and improved, leveraging Shadcn UI's features.
- Dark and light mode compatibility should be maintained.

**Actual Behavior**

Currently, we are using plain Tailwind CSS, which requires additional classes and dark mode classes in each component, resulting in a lot of redundant code. This issue can be addressed by integrating Shadcn UI.

**Additional Information**

- Ensure that the integration does not break any existing functionalities.
- Update documentation to reflect the usage of Shadcn UI components.
- Conduct thorough testing to verify that all refactored components work as expected.
- Provide a style guide or reference for developers to follow when using Shadcn UI in future developments.
author: soham901

comments.body: @FrancescoXX
